column4: I was previously using OSS but just decided to move to alsa, so I installed alsa-base, alsa-utils, alsa-tools... but there' no alsaconf! How can I configure ALSA to use my sound card (I have 2 and I want it to use my YAMAHA sound card)
ubotu
that's a bot right?

look !sound won't help me, it is not an issue with GNOME and besides I use KDE... all I need is to configure ALSA to use a specific sound card in my system.. I have already looked all over Google but can't find an answer... is it much asked to get guided a little bit? Why doesn't Ubuntu have alsaconf in the first place is annoying me! In Debian all I did was to alsaconf >:-|
aoss how should that help me
yeah
best to tinker with the latest greatest
yeah
you learn more
agree.. But I've had bad experiences with Debian when Lenny became Testing...
yeah, and ubuntu is based on debian
I had problems with the graphics on lenny all summer...
Everytime I rebooted I had to reinstall my nvidiadriver
on Lenny my Quadro didn't work at all even when using vesa
thats.. ehm.. good...
doesn't ubuntu have alsaconf o_O
why not?
hehe...
agree..
do you need both soundcards then? or is one of them "built in" to the motherboard?
hm.. I was thinking about that.. Cant you just install alsaconf?
agree
well.. All your statements are so good xD
